metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3748 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free vulnerability was found in the virtio-net device of QEMU.It could occur when the descriptor's address belongs to the non directaccess region, due to num_buffers being set after the virtqueue elem hasbeen unmapped. A malicious guest could use this flaw to crash QEMU,resulting in a denial of service condition, or potentially execute code onthe host with the privileges of the QEMU process.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3748` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.39').
